website_summaries.verdict: The latest Fire HD 8 is a good tablet which is made a bit better in the Plus version. As ever, if you can live with the apps on offer, it’s still fine value.

customer_reviews.title: DOES NOT SUPPORT GOOGLE DRIVE DOCS!
customer_reviews.text: I was so excited to get this new version of the kindle fire. My main purpose for it was to look at recipes in my kitchen, which I store on my google drive. Unfortunately every time I tried to open one of my recipes, the google drive app crashed. Upon taking a quick look online, I found that this is a common problem. Seems that amazon does not support google docs so unfortunately had to return this. Very sad!!!
customer_reviews.author: Emily

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing
customer_reviews.text: Tablet performance and feel okay. I'd read many reviews warning re absence of Google apps, but also that there was a method to install. However, Amazon has removed the ability to do it on this version. Now I have a tablet which is only half useful. Should have bought an Android even a basic one would have been better. Extremely disappointed. EDIT: Amazon customer service contacted me and I've been able to return, great service and easy return - would have added 2 stars.
customer_reviews.author: sue ward

customer_reviews.title: Great value for money - glad to see it uses USB Type-C for charging
customer_reviews.text: Great value tablet. feels well built and refined in the design compared to the Fire HD 8 2018 I had. I really like the inclusion of USB Type-C for charging. For all main social media services (Facebook, Twitter, Instagram) it does a good job, as with messaging services. Great device for video streaming and downloading. I also got a microSD for downloading stuff as well. I bought this device to review on the Tech Travel Geeks. We have already released a video of the unboxing experience on the Tech Travel Geeks YouTube Channel.
customer_reviews.author: Matteo

customer_reviews.title: Does not run any google apps
customer_reviews.text: I am furious. We bought two of these for the kids and found out they do not run any google apps, so you cannot get youtube for kids, or google browser, or youtube etc. You are totally locked into Amazon and if you don't pay for the account you can't get half the services. I want everyone else to realise this before buying. Don't waste your money.
customer_reviews.author: Ms. Alexandra K Brewer

customer_reviews.title: It is not a tablet in the accepted definition of a tablet.
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a new tablet and decided to try the Amazon tablet (As so advertised). This was not a good decision, as this device should never be referred to as a tablet. It is simply an expensive digital advertising device for Amazon products with services no better than you can have for free on a mobile phone. I use Amazon services a lot and find them excellent but they have got this product totally wrong. I returned my product quickly and I have to say I was refunded without a problem. Well done Amazon. Not worth investing in I am afraid
customer_reviews.author: B. L. M

customer_reviews.title: Not for me!
customer_reviews.text: This Kindle fire tablet was bought mainly for using Audio books I find the controls difficult to navigate without basic instructions,(although you can buy the instruction book!), have not found the way to use without Wi Fi as yet, this tablet to me is a shop, I have to fight off advertisements before I can get to my book. Basically not happy with this tablet, and would not recommend to anyone else, to me a total waste of money, definitely not enjoyable experience for me. Sorry!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome tablet for this price
customer_reviews.text: I think this tablet is great, been using it today and have no issues with it at all. Great for streaming and playing games which it’s all aiming to do anyway, it’s not trying to be a replacement for your laptop. I recommend this Tablet for anyone who just wants a decent tablet to watch videos play games a little bit of web browsing , reading and stuff like that. Well done amazon
customer_reviews.author: F. Conte

customer_reviews.title: This is designed for a young target market
customer_reviews.text: My views must be qualified because I am 94 so not as mentally agile as younger people, but from what I can see a lot smarter. This device has more bells and whistles than a circus clown and in terms of ergonomics requires the expenditure of more free attention than is warranted for a labour-saving device (buying a book). Having said that, it claims to be offering services valuable to people who need advice, this is the insidious threat of the web that should be regulated
customer_reviews.author: J. S. Burnett

customer_reviews.title: Impressive cheap tablet!
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely delighted with the purchase. It's not the best tablet on the market and nor is it going to be for the price. I'm using the tablet as a streaming device while working from home. You have access to all the apps you could need and it works flawlessly with them. Battery life is brilliant, was able to play youtube videos and Spotify while working all day without the need to charge (battery life only reduced by 50%) This tablet would be best suited to streaming, browsing the internet, social media and office work such as word and Excel.
customer_reviews.author: Gaz

customer_reviews.title: A solid upgrade for the fire tablets
customer_reviews.text: Arrived this morning and so far so good, a very solid all round performance, nice screen, decent speakers and pretty quick, that extra ram is noticeable. I'm not a gamer so can't really comment on that front but very pleased after a day of exploring and having a play round and battery life seems very much what it says on the box give or take. Extra RAM, a better charger and more storage, I would say its value for money under £150 especially if you are in to the Amazon platform like myself. Five stars from me.
customer_reviews.author: Alykes Ken

customer_reviews.title: Good .. but
customer_reviews.text: Very much value for money if all you want is to browse FB, read books get your email, twitter and messenger tags .. but I wanted it to be able to do what my old Fire 7" could do.. play Moxie (no longer supported) browse ebay (app no longer supported ) - so although its battery is better, its processor is quicker ( ..a bit) it can be charges wirelessly and its slightly larger .. its taken a backward step elsewhere in actively barring some commonly available apps .. seems a slightly childish thing to do Amazon ?
customer_reviews.author: idlee

customer_reviews.title: worthy upgrade from previous models
customer_reviews.text: I purchased 2 hd8+, They work as intended. A worthy upgrade from the hd8 - 8th gen. Pros They are speedy opening app/games. Battery life is perfect (for now as new) - they last around 8-9 hours with intensive use from utube & Roblox. Cons The issue with the screen timeout is still in this version. (firmware). still no option to set screen timeout on the kids profile. EDIT I now own 5 of the 8 hd plus. no problem with the first purchase and no problem so far with the new purchase on prime day.
customer_reviews.author: Judith

customer_reviews.title: Amazon Fire HD 8 Plus 64 GB without Special Offers
customer_reviews.text: The Amazon Fire HD 8 Plus 64 GB is New and Has a Long Battery Life. It is Best to Buy the Fast Wireless Docking Charger for an Extra £39.99. Instead of the Normal Charger Supplied with the Amazon Fire HD Plus 64 GB which takes Up to 4 Hours for a Full Complete Charge. The Wireless Docking Charger Only Takes 2 Hours to take for a Full Complete Charge. In Half the Normal Time!!!
customer_reviews.author: Edward Lee

customer_reviews.title: Not for me.
customer_reviews.text: My home wireless network is working well. Sadly this device would not sustain a connection, it would acquire the network and then immediately drop it. I managed to download the Facebook app, but it wouldn’t get words with friends. Also, I don’t like the Amazon privacy policy in respect of email. It probably had to be done the way they do it because of the clamp on the Amazon OS, sorry, don’t like it. It looks and feels like a well built device. I’m assuming I had a defective unit. Sorry won’t buy it again. Have returned it. I have to say though, Amazon, I do like your customer services.
customer_reviews.author: Bill

customer_reviews.title: Need to download all books from old kindle first
customer_reviews.text: I do like this kindle tablet . A bit thick and quite heavy . The thing I didn't like was that it doesn't automatically pick up your kindle book collections as not same system apparently, which I wasn't pleased about as have over 4500 books . So have to download books and make new collections . The funny bit about it is the old kindle picks up new kindle collections but amazon said that it won't pick up from kindle fire devices as different system altogether . So good luck anyone having more books than me , mind you I have found books I forgot I had so will be reading them again .
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: What is going on with Fire HD8
customer_reviews.text: Could not connect the new HD8 returned it to store .....tried a replacement but same thing!!! would not connect!! We have had a fire 7inch for years so are very disappointed it wouldn't connect....looking on forums other people have had the same issues...perhaps Amazon should look into this problem....so very disappointed!!😡
customer_reviews.author: chillikick

customer_reviews.title: Great value, great little tablet
customer_reviews.text: I initially bought this as I wanted a kindle for reading when out & about, but wanted something value for money that did other stuff. This is certainly it! I can handwrite notes on apps, watch stuff, use Alexa etc. For something I didn't think I'd use much, I haven't put it down! It's pretty quick, good display & use it more than my phone tbh!
customer_reviews.author: kate m

customer_reviews.title: Free for Amazon members?
customer_reviews.text: This devices is specially designed and setup to sell Amazon products and services. It would probably be worth 4 stars if it was free for Amazon members.
customer_reviews.author: Vitor Morais

customer_reviews.title: Horses for courses
customer_reviews.text: Horses for courses. Only good if you get at a discounted price and/or if you are conversant enough to know how to APK Play Store onto it. Amazon apps are seriously lacking in breadth. It is quite nippy for general basic use eg email, browsing, Netflix, Youtube etc However, if you are into buying from Amazon and like reading books downloaded from Amazon and reading in Kindle app it's not a bad wee thing. Just see how much more a Samsung or even more an iPad would cost and this kinda makes this tablet a no brainer. Amazon missed a trick not making the screen a wee bit better tho.
customer_reviews.author: Al Taheegoh

customer_reviews.title: Not What I Expected
customer_reviews.text: At first I thought 'wow' this looks really good. Easy to set up Fairly lightweight and suitable size for viewing. If you want a basic tablet this has a variety of apps and is ok. Battery life very good. Value for money. However, it is very Amazon led. Lots of apps pushing Amazon products, music, videos. I am an eBay seller and use my tablet daily but was unable to download the app as I submit these two companies are in conflict. Also does not seem to support Google apps. Unfortunately not suitable for me. Will buy something else from Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Mrs W of Blackpool

customer_reviews.title: BEWARE - Can't do anything with Google
customer_reviews.text: I was super excited to receive this Fire 8 as I currently have an old Fire 6. And it did not dissapoint, I bought the plum one along with the offical amazon case and it looked great. Perfect size for me and not as bulky as previous ones. It was very responsive and in general I can't say anything bad about this. However this was not fit for use to me. Firstly it wouldn't sync and transfer my fire 6 to fire 8. Secondly none of my google documents can be used and it won't open my older Netgalley documents. This was a real issue for me because it was the main reason I bought it.
customer_reviews.author: Anneke

customer_reviews.title: No worries if you’re updating or replacing your old Kindle HD
customer_reviews.text: I can’t find anything to dislike about this kindle. I’ve had a kindle tablet for many years and was gutted recently when I accidentally crushed the one I’d had for so long. Straight away I ordered a new one. Setting it up to my account was easy and, low & behold, there were my purchased books, apps, music, everything I at first thought was gone forever. Even photos and videos I’d taken years before were there for me to view. I’m toying with the idea of a kindle paper white as I think they’re a bit lighter to hold but in the meantime I’m well happy
customer_reviews.author: Andy61

customer_reviews.title: Impressive tablet...
customer_reviews.text: A great tablet,its very user friendly and the amazon operating system is good.This is my fifth fire tablet and it is the best so far.It works a lot faster than previous models.I use mine mainly for watching videos and playing games and streaming music...The silk browser is ok,but i prefer chrome so I've downloaded the google play store which is easily done and provides access to everything in my google account. Perhaps the only slight fault is the position of the on off button which gets in the way a bit whilst gaming.The speakers are good.
customer_reviews.author: T Ransom

customer_reviews.title: A very worthwhile purchase
customer_reviews.text: I have sent several years trying to decide whether to buy this Fire HD 8. having now purchased one I wish I had bought one years ago. To me the display is very good even though the write-up say otherwise. The size is just perfect for me. The are so many things that it is capable of, I shall never use it to it's full potential. Amazon provide quit a lot of acceptable books free of charge which is good and there is now an app to enable to install non kindle. All round a very good buy for me. books on it.
customer_reviews.author: Barry

customer_reviews.title: Good value for money
customer_reviews.text: Pretty happy with this so far at the price - does everything I wanted with aplomb. My only reservation is my growing realisation that it's trying to do things I don't remember asking it to do e.g. downloading books and videos Amazon thinks I might like. Maybe I'm a bit ungrateful because they are free! But still - a slightly uncomfortable reminder of how much effort they put into tracking everything I am doing, everything I am looking at. I have no more to hide than the next person - maybe less actually, I lead quite a quiet life - just not entirely comfortable at being stared at!
customer_reviews.author: Paul Tayler

customer_reviews.title: A good piece of tech.
customer_reviews.text: It's a good size but much heavier than I expected it to be. Quite painful on my wrists / hands to hold it on my lap as I have arthritis. The cover I bought too leaves few places to hold it comfortably. I use it for reading obviously, but also as a computer. It does similar things to my iPhone which, as an Oldie, I find helpful. It took me ages to work out why there was no sound but I think it's ok now. Overall I am happy with it
customer_reviews.author: S. Widdows

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed and angry
customer_reviews.text: I have the old fire 8hd,battery wearing out So I decided to buy the new 2020 8hd. Very disappointing it is slower down loading,also I cannot get rid of unwanted icons on home page. Also I was to understand that it would automatically down load all my data from my old tablet,it does not. E-mailed Amazon of problems,2 weeks later still waiting,it seems to me that once you buy they could not care less.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: NOT SO GOOD
customer_reviews.text: Got this to replace last years model that I broke. Got it to listen on text to speech. Problem is when screen goes to sleep the text to speech facility stops. I can change how long the screen stays on upto 30 minuets but this uses the battery life. Try to get replacement of 2019 model.
customer_reviews.author: rosemary

customer_reviews.title: Suggest return option as the box is damaged
customer_reviews.text: I purchased it for my child's educational work. Specifically to support the online schooling purpose. But none of the google apps like drive, meet, hangout are supported by the device. It's a total waste for me. My kid has damaged the box. Please suggest, how can I return? Accordingly I can plan to purchase one android tab.
customer_reviews.author: Chayan

customer_reviews.title: Love my Fire HD Plus Tablet.
customer_reviews.text: This is a present to myself on my pending retirement. I'm so pleased that I made the right choice. It's easy to use and its great having a camera again. I can't go into technicalities as I'm no expert, but I wouldn't be without it and I've only been using it for just over a week. The battery life is great and charges quickly. I'm still discovering things but I'm really having fun and enjoying my new purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Satisfied customer from Kyle

customer_reviews.title: Nice little tablet
customer_reviews.text: I picked this up on Prime Day for my daughter to replace an old Hudl 2. So far it seems pretty good, especially for the half price deal I got it on. It's pretty snappy and responsive. The screen is clear and plenty bright enough. I usually run it about 60% brightness. I followed a guide online to install the Google Play store and I can now install YouTube Kids for my daughter, along with other apps from the Google Play store that she needs. The battery seems quite good so far, but once it beds in I think it will improve slightly. The build quality seems good and it sits nicely in the hand.
customer_reviews.author: Mr I Langley

customer_reviews.title: I can't use internet or sign up my WiFi
customer_reviews.text: I like the tablet fire 8 hd but the thing is I can't use my wi fi it won't let me connect with to the network and I think I have to buy as card for it and for me to use the internet
customer_reviews.author: clifton

customer_reviews.title: On Fire
customer_reviews.text: Bought purely as a cheaper option than an ipad but larger than a smartphone to pack in my DSLR camera rucksack. Adds no weight. Connects to my camera's Wi-Fi in the field so I can check my shots then syncs with my Creative Cloud back home (or use your phone as a mobile hot-spot if you can't wait) for editing on the desktop. (Though if you install the play store, Lightroom and photoshop both work fine). I've only downloaded 4 photo related apps so not to overwork the ram. It's not the best resolution screen or best speakers (try the HD10), but it's a great solution for £60 to edit RAW on the go.
customer_reviews.author: Capt.

customer_reviews.title: Good battery life but almost useless until you install Google Play Store
customer_reviews.text: The battery life is excellent and the screen very acceptable. There is no GPS receiver. The device is significantly thicker than a normal tablet. The default source of apps is Amazon's own app store, which won't have your favourite programs. There are plenty of sets of instructions telling you how to install Google's Play Store on the tablet. It takes a few minutes and gives you access to almost all the Google Apps. Some Google Apps won't run because the device isn't certified. I have read that Netflix is one but Netflix is available from the Amazon App store is that this not a problem.
customer_reviews.author: David Roe

customer_reviews.title: Still a great tablet
customer_reviews.text: This tablet continues to be a very good choice. I previously had an older version (3rd gen) that the battery was starting to fail on. One thing I have noticed is that not all apps adjust if I open the tablet the wrong way up. Most apps will turn to be correct but some don't. One such is Cube Connect. I have spoken to them and they have said the app never had auto rotate. But on the old fire tablet it rotated to orientate correctly. The new tablet doesn't. It seems as though Amazon have made an "improvement" that doesn't suit all apps. Other than that it's still a great tablet
customer_reviews.author: MFP

customer_reviews.title: easy to set up
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because my previous kindle broke after over 6 years. I'm not too technically minded so was prepared to have to ask for help to set this up. How wrong I was. The kindle was already charged when I received it and the set up instructions were easy to follow onscreen. It synced with my account straight away so all my books appeared by the time I'd completed the set up. Would recommend it
customer_reviews.author: Andrea

customer_reviews.title: Display not working
customer_reviews.text: This screen display was like this after a reboot after day one. After numerous attempts to get a replacement via returns I can't get a simple replacement and its proving incredibly difficult. Please can customer service sort this out.
customer_reviews.author: N J O'Sullivan

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: 64 gb storage plus as card means I'm never going to run out of memory, I've downloaded Google play so I have the best of both worlds, I have the 8 inch display as I find the 10 inch to heavy. It's easy to use and good battery life and tremendous value for money. I've always liked kindle and I have got my grandkids one each. Also in my research before I purchased my kindle alot of tech sites said Google had tired of the tablet market and were pulling out whilst Huawei were a bad bet because China is acting like the bad guys in a Bruce Lee movie at the moment
customer_reviews.author: bullets

customer_reviews.title: It's Fine
customer_reviews.text: It's okay. Frankly, I would still be using my old fire but it wasn't being supported any more so I decided to buy this one. There are a few irritations. Sometimes when I tap on items on Amazon a different item pops up or nothing happens at all. A few times I've struggled to download books. I thought it was something I did in the short time I've had it and reset it to factory settings but no. It can also go a little blurry and the sound volume can fade in and out when listening to a song. I do like it. I just still like my old fire so much better, oh ever so much better.
customer_reviews.author: Sandra

customer_reviews.title: Great for the Basics, Brilliant for Amazon Features
customer_reviews.text: If you like surfing the net, reading books, looking at Amazon movies, checking emails - basic stuff - then you can't go past this for value and quality. Only fault I've found is that it has random alert tones that I have to go into the settings and disable - not really a criticism. I've also found the built-in Alexa features really helpful, especially since I've been using it for basic things like music playlists, setting alarms etc. Screen quality is excellent and sound pretty good and for the price definitely worth it if you use other Amazon services
customer_reviews.author: Paul Newland

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product as I am severely sight impaired and wanted a bigger screen. I have always trusted Amazon roduct so this was an easy choice. For me the lettering size is fantastic on the largest setting. There is no glare that i can tell which when you only have a small amount of sight left in one eye is important. I use this mainly for reading the fact i can change the back ground colour to black with white writing helps me a lot. I use daily a few hours reading and checking emails and only have to charge every 3 to 4 days. Highley recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Dmc

customer_reviews.title: Does not work with hidden wi-fi networks
customer_reviews.text: OK, so the product seems well made and presented, and the display is fine. But it won't connect to your Wi-Fi network if it doesn't expose the network name (SSID) as is the case with "hidden" Wi-Fi networks. I'm going to be optimistic that this is just a bug in a new product, and that an update will fix it in the future, but until then I've got an expensive hand mirror.
customer_reviews.author: A. Homer

customer_reviews.title: A real improvement on earlier Fire
customer_reviews.text: Bought to replace an earlier Fire 7, this HD 8 has a much improved screen and battery life, and programmes load much quicker and it’s more stability, presumably thanks to a faster chip and improved operating system software . The biggest difference, however, is with Silk internet browser which now loads quickly, runs smoothly and effectively and is so much better than my experience on the earlier Fire. For the price it’s difficult to see how for general internet use, reading Kindle books, listening to Audible books, one could do better.
customer_reviews.author: Setter man

customer_reviews.title: Not best for reading Kindle books.
customer_reviews.text: We found that the screen is not easy to read in strong light. The screen jumps about without any instruction, which can be very disappointing when trying to read something. The extra facilities with this model are useful, but if it is used mainly to read Kindle books, we prefer the previous model.
customer_reviews.author: David L.Hotham

customer_reviews.title: The best.
customer_reviews.text: This was an upgrade from my old Kindle and my goodness what a great tablet. Does everything I want it too and more, The screen is excellent,, content excellent.. my only downer is the sound.. It is not as loud or as smooth as the old Kindle, and have read many other comments saying the same. It uses different speakers on this, and they are not nearly as good as the old kindle.. Saying that.. I would be listening mostly through headphones,, where the sound then, is adaptable to a much higher level.. But all in all, a great tablet
customer_reviews.author: Alyson gill

customer_reviews.title: Pretty neat tablet for media browsing on the go or around the house.
customer_reviews.text: Not being in the modern day with phones I needed something to read and watch a growing backlog of e-books and tutorial videos away from the computer. So far the tablet (along with a 128 micro sd for increased storage) has done the job pretty well, have been able to start getting through the backlog at a quicker pace. The battery life is pretty decent too, though i don't use too many of the power hungry apps. The 2 mp camera is decent enough for grabbing quick photos for reference gathering if my main camera is away.
customer_reviews.author: B. Fox

customer_reviews.title: Good size screen, high quality images but layout is questionable
customer_reviews.text: My old Kindle Fire HD was not being supported by the apps and SkyGo was not working on it, so I had to upgrade. I went for a slightly bigger screen and glad I did, it makes such a difference. It is heavier than the more expensive tablets, but I could not afford to spend loads. The battery life is good. The layout however is questionable, I liked the old layout of having a carousel, with your book and apps that you are using regularly, making everything easy to find. Now there are headings, Books, Video, Games & Apps etc.
customer_reviews.author: slimby13

customer_reviews.title: All-New Fire HD 8 Plus tablet, 8" HD display, 32 GB
customer_reviews.text: A birthday treat for me. Looks good and works well. Only frustrating thing is the ads/promotions which appear regularly. I used to be able to remove these from old kindle by selecting not interested but whilst this is an option on new kindle it doesn't work and item remains on screen! I did contact Amazon customer service who said they had removed ads free of charge but issue remains. No reply to further emails I have subsequently sent!! However love the kindle and its functionality this is just a minor annoyance.
customer_reviews.author: Tracy M

customer_reviews.title: Not much of an upgrade
customer_reviews.text: I have to say I'm disappointed with this latest iteration of the kindle fire 8. I've had a few kindle fire tablets over the years and frankly the older ones performed better and it feels like there have been a number of compromises made to bring in at a low price point. I appreciate this is a budget offering but even with that in view performance is very sluggish. Even more disheartening is the battery. It takes an eternity to charge and once finally powered up depletes rapidly such that you'd be lucky to get more than a few hours use out of it.
customer_reviews.author: Mrs

customer_reviews.title: Exceptional battery life.
customer_reviews.text: I love it, for the most part. Battery life and storage is far superior to my previous fire (4th gen) Only niggle I can come up with is this: I review books as a hobby, so I get a lot of files sent to kindle. On the old kindle, these files appeared on the home page as they were received. Here, they do not, nor do they show up on the for you page. I have to access the docs folder every time to carry on reading. It's annoying more than anything! But overall I'd still give it 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Debbie Attenborough

customer_reviews.title: Good tablet but not for me
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace my previous fire where the charging port was broken. I couldn’t keep progress on my games apps. That’s not the tablet’s fault but as a result of GameCircle not continuing. It wasn’t particularly good for reading in bright light either - if it had been, that would have been a reason to keep it. I sent it back. I liked the charging dock - a separate item - very much. Given the problems I had with the deterioration of the previous port, that was really the main reason for buying. So that was a big positive.
customer_reviews.author: AJ50

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight and Portable
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace one which is coming to the end of its life. I use it more as an e reader, but fits in my handbag when going away and I can read emails ect. I do like the pearlised colour. I don't like that the front camera is now down the side, where I tend to hold it as if I cover the lens it makes the kindle face go darker. The on/off switch has been moved to the opposite side, near to the sound buttons - takes getting used to after years of a kindle. I do like the 'new' shape, more like an ipad
customer_reviews.author: beacon124

customer_reviews.title: An Improvement
customer_reviews.text: Had this tablet for almost a month now, and I must say I'm impressed. I had a fire 7 before, and this is a lot quicker than that. The extra inch on the screen makes enough of a difference to make it worth buying. OK it can't compete with an Apple, but there again, it's not trying to. This is a fifth of the price. But if you just want a basic tablet with an acceptible screen and quick access to all things Amazon, this is for you. I use it mainly as a Kindle, and for that it is great. USB C is a big step forward too. I love it.
customer_reviews.author: Peter Gibbard

customer_reviews.title: Superb
customer_reviews.text: I love my kindle fire and would be completely lost without it. I read books and play games on it daily and watch tv series and videos frequently. It is perfect for so many things including day to day stuff like emails and catching up on the latest news etc. I'm so glad I paid the extra and bought this plus version as it is much quicker and more efficient than my old hd8. Battery life is excellent and it recharges quickly. If I could give it more than 5 stars I would. It really is that good
customer_reviews.author: Brigato

customer_reviews.title: Great tablet
customer_reviews.text: My new Fire HD 8 Plus tablet is great. I bought it to replace my old Amazon Fire HDX that I purchased in 2014 and it does not disappoint. The screen size is ideal for reading and/or watching video. The battery life is great, although like all tablets the battery doesn't last as long when streaming. However, it charges to full capacity within a few hours. Screen quality if excellent as is the sound when watching video. As well as 64gb storage it has 3gb ram and the ability to add 1 TB of expandable storage. It appears to be on offer at the moment (which I missed) so I would say go for it. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great value and performance
customer_reviews.text: Bought to replace an old Lenovo tablet. Very easy to set up. The battery life is great...I'm not using it all day every day but it is mostly switched on and I'm charging it every 3-4 days depending on my usage. The only difficulty that I had was setting up the google home app to control hubs around the house as this had previously been controlled from the old tablet (I'm guessing as google is Alexa's direct competitor). Teenage help overcame the problem. I highly recommend this tablet...so pleased with it for both price and performance.!
customer_reviews.author: Happyshopper

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: Love the tablet, shame it is a different shape and I have had to replace my stand and cover. Battery life is very good and I like that you press the on/off button to take a screen shot. Could do with an option to make a .pdf instead of a .jpeg but with a little messing you can do it. I like the wider screen for reading Kindle books etc. Colours are very good. I can read also in bright sunlight so that is a bonus. Just need a peak to shield my eyes from the sun and it is fine.
customer_reviews.author: Banger01

customer_reviews.title: Great Value for money - beware of the ads though
customer_reviews.text: Great Tablet that I've brought for my kids to keep them entertained on long journeys... I download video content with my Prime account and a full battery is enough for 2 long journeys. I play the audio using the car's Bluetooth connectivity with the sound faded to the rear, I should have done this a lot sooner! Only down side is that I didn't know what special offers was all about, now I do! :-( It's basically an advert that pops up each time you lock the screen (not so much of a special offer) but some of these adverts I find are not appropriate for young children so something to be aware of.
customer_reviews.author: Vinny

customer_reviews.title: Over all good BUTnot good with non amazon books help line rubish
customer_reviews.text: Overall happy with my new fire 8 BUT very dissapointed with the fact that any books not bought through amazon would not open on it. After trying to move via usb from old kindle to new then going to manage content and still not having any joy contacted help line via live chat, disaster cut of 4 times 5 different people told me to do 3 different things non of which worked. The only way i managed it was to us a format changer program to change them all to pdf format and that was the only way i could get them to open.
customer_reviews.author: Lynn Parker

customer_reviews.title: Good tablet for the price.
customer_reviews.text: Great tablet except for wifi issues, It showed connected but I had to constantly switch wifi off and on to reconnect. The solution was to go into my router settings and turn off use both 2.5GHz and 5 GHz then turn off the 5GHz option all together it now does not drop connection. Something Amazon needs to sort out I think. As many of my other devices of Amazon origin didn't show or ever had the connection issue. But now very happy with it but I nearly sent it back.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I love the kindles, they are easy to use and understand, not too heavy to carry in the cases. they charge up quickly and have a good memory usage. I use mine mostly to read, this is my 5th kindle in the last 10 years. My first is still going strong but its an early kindle so really only for reading. I have a 10 inch kindle which is really good for reading but is too heavy to take out in a handbag which means that the new 8 inch is better for use away from home.
customer_reviews.author: Branna

customer_reviews.title: great value and updated well worth purchasing
customer_reviews.text: I use this kindle for purchasing goods and tv from amazonprime. I decided to give up on my two previous kindles as they no longer charge and I have had them for about10 years so needed an update This is lightweight , slim and easy for the handbag or backpack.On setup it transferred over everything from my old kindle Inc. all photos and I was able to use it straight away. Great price and easy to charge seems to last a lot longer than previous kindles.
customer_reviews.author: Krys

customer_reviews.title: Great tablet, with caveats
customer_reviews.text: A great little tablet, but the extra GB of ram is hard to notice. The CPU in the 10" 2019 version is faster, so this feels a little more sluggish, despite more RAM. Easy to use, decent screen, though 1080p would have been nicer, and brightness isn't stellar. Hard to argue with the price though.
customer_reviews.author: Doc Robotnik

customer_reviews.title: Quality - once again! 🙏
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely over the moon with this tablet! Crisp clear in all regards, very responsive in all it's equipped to do, solid and sound, and a perfect size for purpose, lightweight too. Further, and as per, it arrived promptly and was boxed with Amazon's usual outstandingly tidy precision. Thank you, Amazon, once again! 👍🙏
customer_reviews.author: Bob

customer_reviews.title: Amazon fire tab 8 plus
customer_reviews.text: Was an upgrade on my previous generation fire hd 8 its grate easy to use runs smoother and faster the camera is on the landscape side of the tab witch would make it good for video calling for staying safe this year its thin and light weight I absolutely love it much nicer than its perdiseser
customer_reviews.author: paula fothergill

customer_reviews.title: Good all round basic tablet
customer_reviews.text: The new Fire HD 8 Plus is a great little tablet at an affordable price. It is sturdy, well made, lightweight, very easy to use and has lots of apps through Amazon app store to keep you entertained and informed. It is fast and responsive and the sound quality/volume are good. The graphics are good for the price. I haven't tried the camera yet so can't comment on that. I bought this to take on my travels and have been very happy with it. I bought the one without 'special offers' as I find all the adverts really annoying. If you are looking for an inexpensive tablet for day to day browsing you will not be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Carol K

customer_reviews.title: Locked unknown sources apps
customer_reviews.text: Good for internet and games. Don’t buy if you need to download unknown sources such as cinema hd. Amazon has locked some apps and does not allow to download apps from unknown sources.
customer_reviews.author: sandra

customer_reviews.title: New Kindle Fire 8
customer_reviews.text: I like the shape better than the narrower longer shape of my old Kindle. This one seems to have a faster processor so moves from one programme to another very quickly. It is a nice size to hold in one hand and this time II have bought a white model rather than black as I had before and I feel it is classy especially as I bought the amazon shell case in white to protect it. It will fit in my medium sized handbag if I want to take it out with me at any time, and I just love it.
customer_reviews.author: Silverlady8

customer_reviews.title: More things you can't than can do with it
customer_reviews.text: Not exactly enamoured with the new kindle but did give it four months before writing the review to give it a chance. The plusses are the delivery and condition and access to books is as good as ever. The negatives are limited amount of apps available compared to android and apple, very slow in processing, often disconnects from the internet and subsequently not as useful as I would've hoped. Buy one for reading alone and it's fine, buy one for wider use then get an Android or apple
customer_reviews.author: carl

customer_reviews.title: A Good Inexpensive Tablet
customer_reviews.text: I am pleasantly surprised by how good the 'All New Amazon Fire HD 8' is! I am more familiar with Samsung tablets so an Amazon device takes a little getting used to. I waited until Amazon Prime Day for 50% off to make sure I got extra value for money. As far as I can tell the fact that it doesn't come with Google Play Apps and it has locked screen adverts does not detract from the experience of using it. I may decide to learn how to tweak things to my preferences but right now it's perfectly alright.
customer_reviews.author: M. Hilton

customer_reviews.title: If it ain't broke . . .
customer_reviews.text: I am annoyed that the charger is new and that I can't use the old one which has seen me through eight previous kindles. I find the FAQs are not any Qs I have ever A'd even inF! (The Questions I've ever Asked, even inFrequently) I've asked and asked to make Google my home page but it doesn't happen, the top of the page when in Silk Browser repeatedly turns black and I find it very difficult to access a document page to write on
customer_reviews.author: Joe Koot

customer_reviews.title: Sorry fire going backwards not forwards
customer_reviews.text: Sorry didnt like, took nearly all day to download new update when I took out of box..and the battery life is short on audible, so much so i didnt feel it was a new one but a refurbished one..and web page addresses keep coming up when I go into kindle..no sorry not impressed.
customer_reviews.author: debra bradshaw

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed with Amazon
customer_reviews.text: This is my 3rd kindle I think they are great, however my NEW kindle turned up today in a damaged box, finger prints all over the screen and some scratches. It's obviously not brand new. I'm extremely disappointed with Amazon & will be returning it. I was going to ask for a replacement but because it's prime day customer service is too busy. Now requested a refund and I will order another one & see what condition that one arrives in.
customer_reviews.author: ADG

customer_reviews.title: Excellent handheld size tablet
customer_reviews.text: Bought this as second tablet to my iPad Pro for book and magazine reading as Mini iPad far more expensive and....well I already have an iPad. Easy and speedy to set up the Fire HD 8 Plus fits the bill very nicely especially at the price. Very solidly made (bought the case to go with it, also very well made), 64gb ample for my use but extendable storage via SD slot if required, ready installed Apps biased towards Amazon but understandable, many many more available of course.......what else can I say - I happy with it and would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: PJCOOL

customer_reviews.title: Faster Fire - just as many adverts!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought the "without special offers" version and I expected to have less adverts popping up every time I try to access anything. What did I pay an extra £10 for? Even more irritating is to see the same item advertised for £25 off less than 10 days after receiving my new Fire. It does everything my older version did, only faster and just as many adverts
customer_reviews.author: Mrs C

customer_reviews.title: Great for an oldie
customer_reviews.text: I'm 89 and this is my first tablet. I was scared I would find it too complicated for me, but this has definitely not been the case. Buying a surprisingly cheap Bluetooth speaker to get more volume has made it just about perfect. I use more features than I expected too.
customer_reviews.author: Nick Landon

customer_reviews.title: Great little tablet
customer_reviews.text: Bought for a 10 year old who many uses it for Minecraft, Adopt Me and various other gaming apps. Battery life is much longer than on the previous Kindle Generation. Was a bit disappointed that the charging port, volume controls and camera have moved position so it was necessary to purchase a replacement cover at the same time. Also uses the USB C connector rather than the micro B as on the previous version, which has rendered a lot of our old chargers obsolete so they've had to be replaced as well.
customer_reviews.author: Debs

customer_reviews.title: Hopefully a one off problem
customer_reviews.text: My wife who plays several games on this device was a bit annoyed yesterday. The reason being, when she turned it on all she could get on screen was Alexa showing what she could do and she could no get anything else, even though she turned it off several times. She about to send the device back, but she turned it off for about an hour and then turned it on again and everything appeared to work. Hopefully this was just a small gliche.
customer_reviews.author: plumbob

customer_reviews.title: Convenient, lightweight mobile computer!
customer_reviews.text: What I don't like is the controls at the bottom of the tablet. When you are playing a game it is quite easy to catch and you end up paused or dead! I think it is because I am left handed. My earliest Kindle Fire had the controls on the right hand side and I found this much better. I really like my Kindle Fire and use it all the time, either surfing the net or playing games. It is quite light and easy to carry round.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace my 2017 HD Fire (nothing more than a loose charging port wrong with it but fancied upgrading) and just like the 2017 version, I love it. I also like that Alexa is on it (in the earlier version I had to long press a button to speak to Alexa) and I can just speak to it after activating the Alexa functions. It’s a lot shorter and more compact than before but same screen size. A very good tablet.
customer_reviews.author: Christina

customer_reviews.title: What's not to like
customer_reviews.text: This is our second Kindle Fire and we bought it because the first one is great and, let's be honest, the £18/month interest-free offer makes the purchasing decision that much easier. I don't really see the point in paying more for an iPad when this is so good.
customer_reviews.author: Dolly

customer_reviews.title: worst device ever
customer_reviews.text: no compatibility with any app you may need. this device is truly useless
customer_reviews.author: Solberry Oak

customer_reviews.title: This is dreaful
customer_reviews.text: We have 2 kindles and a fire kids tablet so I thought I would try the adult tablet. This is dreadful, it's so unresponsive and it's so difficult to install an app that is not authorised by Amazon, of which there are so few. I just wanted it for googling things and streaming things but it's really not fit for purpose in that respect. If you are accustomed to iOS or Android I think you will hate this.
customer_reviews.author: joted

customer_reviews.title: Not suited to Zoom calls.
customer_reviews.text: Bought it for use with Zoom calls as it was one of the most economical ways to do so. However had to return it as participants on Zoom complained that my audio Quality was very poor even when I connected Bluetooth audio devices. Tested simultaneously on a call with iPad and feedback was the audio on Fire Tablet was very poor. Can’t explain why it should be so. Returned it. Important to note that Gallery view on Zoom is limited to 4 callers per screen. Otherwise an easy to use and economical tablet.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice and lightweight
customer_reviews.text: I've had a Fire8 for about 5 years (so good going), just stopped switching on one day so purchased this new one. Disappointed to find that the original - although a Fire 8 - measured 8.9" whilst this is a true 8" so basically now finding it small compared to the last and wish I'd bought the 10". On the plus side, it is lighter and screen seems sharper. Bought when on offer so a good price for what you get.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Kindle Fire 8
customer_reviews.text: If you have invested in the Amazon universe then having a kindle is the perfect seamless gateway to enjoy books, movies, music, shopping, communication and security. The latest kindle fire 8 has the added bonus of having show mode so you can ask Alexa hands free to display pictures, tell and show you the weather and news, view security cameras etc...it's fun inexpensive entertainment and should it break (they are very robust, having dropped mine many times without issue) cheap to replace unlike an iPad. Downsides: no "easy" access to the Google play store for apps and I have found it hard to integrate into the Microsoft world for productivity.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Pleased
customer_reviews.text: Only had it a short time but so far im happy with my purchase. Be realistic and don't expect a ipad but it really does depend what u want it for. I just want it to read and watch iplayer and netflix on. Im not looking to take photos or play games on it and do social media. If i wanted more id look to buy a better tablet. I got this on sale and i love the size of it also. Pefect for the kindle app. Screen is not the most responsive but again u get what u pay for but saying that im happy so far.
customer_reviews.author: CarryOnBoo

customer_reviews.title: Nearly perfect, only a few things Amazon needs to work on...
customer_reviews.text: The main focus for next-generation should be increasing the resolution, at the moment it's fairly grainy and understandably at 720p on an 8inch tablet. Minimum should be 1080p. Colours also could be better for the screen. Button placement and camera placement should be reworked, makes it harder to turn it on and off as well as taking pictures when your camera is placed on the side of your tablet. Other than this, it's good for the price, you can easily change Fire OS for something more Android stock like if you look around the internet.
customer_reviews.author: William S.

customer_reviews.title: Convinced me with the blurb but not with the product.
customer_reviews.text: Bit disappointed really. I thought I was buying a new improved Kindle Fire but it's very hard to find any improvements. It is smaller (obviously) than the 10inch version and lighter, but more awkward to handle. It seems to have a life of its own too. With 64gb I was expecting something special over my old 32gb but I've yet to find anything different...maybe need to invest in a Samsung (or maybe not!)
customer_reviews.author: DG

customer_reviews.title: excellent replacement with caveat
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace a previous fire HD7 which did not have much capacity. Battery life is good and the extra screen size is also great. However I was very disappointed that two of my important "go to" apps on my previous home screen - ETSY & EBAY are not available via the appstore on this model. A chat with Amazon revealed that this is a "technical issue" Please sort ASAP Amazon ! It is annoying to only be able to access my ETSY & EBAY account via a web browser
customer_reviews.author: Jeannie

customer_reviews.title: Mixed feelings
customer_reviews.text: The most disappointing thing with this tablet is that the screen is dreadful to read when it is sunny or outside. I had to buy a non reflective screen which works ok but the air bubbles make it look as if there is a mould growing underneath but at least I can read in the conservatory now. Why are these screen not non reflective. Surely when on holiday or reading outside this is an important issue.
customer_reviews.author: Jane

customer_reviews.title: Good for streaming and web browsing
customer_reviews.text: Pro's Nice screen and high definition Great for streaming and watching films Very good battery life and takes no time to charge Great price compared to the big boys Cons Poor layout and not as user friendly as other tablets- can be frustrating to navigate Poor compatibility with favourite day to day apps (no Google chrome, maps etc) Downloaded and paid for games from Amazon app store which don't work and just crash the device Overall great for the price of you only wanna stream of browse the internet. Anymore than that and consider paying a bit more for a better device
customer_reviews.author: Mr. B. R. Williams

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic tablet - superb value for money!
customer_reviews.text: This is another great little tablet. It looks good, is quick and responsive, and has a fantastic HD screen. But it's biggest plus point is its value for money - absolutely superb! I wouldn't hesitate in recommending this new kindle - really like it.
customer_reviews.author: W. A. Seddon

customer_reviews.title: Very slow
customer_reviews.text: The Fire 8 HD is much slower than the older fire models. After a recent OS update it slowed down even more.
customer_reviews.author: Jerome M.

customer_reviews.title: Great tablet with long battery life
customer_reviews.text: Very pleased with the tablet, it has excellent battery life, it will last several days on a charge with average usage. It is easy to use and intuitive. Alexa is built in and works like a charm. Only disappointment is the lack of apps, it only has apps from the Amazon app store and there are a few ones that you would expect to have that are missing though most are covered
customer_reviews.author: M. Peneycad

customer_reviews.title: Nw Kindle Fire
customer_reviews.text: Purchased an 8inch Fire this time, I have a 10inch but do not like the orange screen strange colour, I also have one of the first Kindle Fire from 2012 a 7inch, the 8inch has more features than the early 7inch, I am still feeling my way around the features, looks good, I think the case is needed to protect the Kindle, (a little expensive but feels quality) So far I am happy with this Kindle.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. R.S. Goulding

customer_reviews.title: Best value and great for kids
customer_reviews.text: These are great for my kids. Add a screen protector and case and then the kids can use all year with no damage. They are clearly not iPad standard but also clearly not iPad price. Gets a bit of getting used to but I think they are perfect for kids. You can give them their own profile and there are settings where you can monitor how much they use per day. Love these and highly recommmeded.
customer_reviews.author: Yon

customer_reviews.title: Brilliant
customer_reviews.text: Sadly I couldnt continue to use my old Amazon Fire tablet because the charging point had become damaged. I managed to get a great deal on this 8"HD tablet. There is so much more functionality and of course all the additional features of Alexa, and the Fire Stick combined. It is quick and easy to use, slightly different buttons etc but easy to get used to. The children are over the moon.
customer_reviews.author: Katrina

customer_reviews.title: Lovelky , easy to use tablet/reader
customer_reviews.text: I had a HD 7 Fire for 5 yes loved it easy to use as tablet & reader, so when it's operating system was no longer supported, changed to a new one. Old one given away as just reader. New one brill, screen responsive, clearer & stillness to use As an older user I did not need or use a laptop or PC. So Kindle HE is brilliant for me, cost effective & does everything I ask if it.
customer_reviews.author: Jan Pepper

customer_reviews.title: Lovely Piece of Work
customer_reviews.text: So much better than the 7" model I bought last time . It's fast, clear, connective. As good as the third generation model which I've had for years, but of course this one has up to date apps. The second model I bought last year, was so bad I thought I'd not get another, but I gambled on this and it paid off. Mind you, this is the best version out there, but you get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.author: Eliot

product_meta.title: All-New Fire HD 8 Tablet, 8" HD display, 32 GB, Black with Special Offers, designed for portable entertainment
feature_bullets: 8" HD display, twice the storage (32 or 64 GB of internal storage and up to 1 TB with microSD card) + 2 GB RAM.
Up to 12 hours of reading, browsing the web, watching video and listening to music.
Now with USB C for easier charging. Fully charges in under 5 hours (with included cable + adaptor).
30% faster thanks to the new 2.0 GHz quad-core processor.
Enjoy your favourite apps like BBC iPlayer, Netflix, Disney+, Facebook, Instagram, TikTok, YouTube and more through the Amazon Appstore (Google Play Store not supported). Subscription fees may apply.
Introducing Game mode: a distraction-free and optimised gaming experience.
Do more with Alexa built-in: use just your voice to play videos, check the weather, dim lights and stream music.
2 MP front- and rear-facing cameras with 720p HD video recording.
